title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 1. (1) These Rules, which may be cited as the Rules of the Superior Courts
text_raw:
1. (1) These Rules, which may be cited as the Rules of the Superior Courts 
(Service in Wardship Proceedings) 2021, shall come into operation on 24th day 
of November 2021. 

(2) These Rules shall be construed together with the Rules of the Superior 

Courts. 

(3) The Rules of the Superior Courts as amended by these Rules may be cited 

as the Rules of the Superior Courts 1986 to 2021.
text_norm: 1 (1) rule may cited rule superior court (service wardship proceedings) 2021 shall come operation 24th day november 2021 (2) rule shall construed together rule superior court (3) rule superior court amended rule may cited rule superior court 1986 2021

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 2. The Rules of the Superior Courts are amended:
text_raw:
2. The Rules of the Superior Courts are amended: 

(i) 

by the substitution for rules 94 and 95 of Order 67 of the 
following rules respectively: 

“94.(1) Service of notice of presentation of an originating 
petition as required by rules 8, 23 and 35 shall be effected by 
personal service by delivering to and leaving with the 
respondent a true copy of the petition, with the notice thereon 
indorsed, and at the same time showing him the attested copy 
indorsed with the appropriate notice. The person serving 
such notice shall, at the same time, read to the respondent the 
contents of the petition served on him or her and explain its 
nature and implications. Save as is hereinafter provided, 
service of any other document upon a respondent or ward 
shall be effected by delivering it to the respondent personally. 

(2) The provisions of these Rules as to substituted service 
shall not apply unless the Judge otherwise directs.
text_norm: 2 rule superior court amended (i) substitution rule 94 95 order 67 following rule respectively 94.(1) service notice presentation originating petition required rule 8 23 35 shall effected personal service delivering leaving respondent true copy petition notice thereon indorsed time showing attested copy indorsed appropriate notice person serving notice shall time read respondent content petition served explain nature implication save hereinafter provided service document upon respondent ward shall effected delivering respondent personally (2) provision rule substituted service shall apply unless judge otherwise directs

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 95. In every case, an affidavit of service of such notice or
text_raw:
95. In every case, an affidavit of service of such notice or 
document shall be filed with the Registrar stating particularly 
the time, place, and mode of service, and include an averment 
in respect of the efforts made by the deponent to explain the 
nature and implications of the papers served on the 
respondent and set out any response of the respondent. Such 
affidavit shall be in the Form No 15.”, and 

(ii) by the substitution for Form No. 15 in Appendix K of the 

form set out in the Schedule. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 23rd November, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [600] 

O. 67, r. 95 

Schedule 

“No. 15. 

AFFIDAVIT OF SERVICE OF NOTICE OF ORIGINATING PETITION. 

____________________ 

[Heading as in Form No. 1]. 

In the matter of A.B., respondent. 

I, [name] of [address] aged 18 years and upwards, make oath and say as follows:—
text_norm: 95 every case affidavit service notice document shall filed registrar stating particularly time place mode service include averment respect effort made deponent explain nature implication paper served respondent set response respondent affidavit shall form 15 (ii) substitution form no 15 appendix k form set schedule notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 23rd november 2021 4 600 o 67 r 95 schedule no 15 affidavit service notice originating petition heading form no 1  matter a.b respondent name address aged 18 year upwards make oath say follows --

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 1. On the ………day of …………..20…., between the hours of ……. and …….. I
text_raw:
1. On the ………day of …………..20…., between the hours of ……. and …….. I 
personally served the respondent with notice of the petition herein.
text_norm: 1 day 20 hour   personally served respondent notice petition herein

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 2. I effected such service at [set out the address at which service was effected] by
text_raw:
2. I effected such service at [set out the address at which service was effected] by 
showing him/her personally an attested copy of the said petition with the 
appropriate notice thereon indorsed, and at the same time delivering to him/her in 
person and leaving with him/her a true copy of the same including the indorsement.

heading: 5. On the ………day of …………..20…., being within …. days of such service I
text_raw:

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 7. Before swearing this affidavit I have marked the said attested copy of the petition
text_raw:
7. Before swearing this affidavit I have marked the said attested copy of the petition 
with the letter "A" and have indorsed my name thereon. 

Sworn &c.

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These rules amend Order 67 rules 94 and 95 and Form No. 15 Appendix K, of 
the Rules of the Superior Courts relating to service on the respondent in 
proceedings seeking a declaration of wardship, by removing the provisions on 
non-personal service thereby making personal service mandatory in all cases, 
including a provision requiring the petition to be read and explained to the 
respondent and amending Form No. 15 accordingly. 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [600]
